website_summaries.verdict: The best amateur sound mixer on the market in terms of sound quality and affordability.
pros: An affordable sound mixer with professional touches like preamp and 2-Band British EQ
cons: A few reports of a faulty (loose) power supply

customer_reviews.title: Great little mixer.
customer_reviews.text: This little mixer does exactly what it is supposed to. And the sound quality is great. I'm using it to take output from my TV and output from an Echo Dot and feed them through a small 40W amp to some nice bookshelf speakers. Now, I don't have to mess around with swapping inputs or toggling switches to change the source for the speakers. I can start a Pandora station on my FireTV and ask Alexa what the weather is tomorrow and get to hear how it's going to be 12 degrees (8 with the windchill) while the music continues on uninterrupted.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Hughvers

customer_reviews.title: Good and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Needed a mini mixer to go from my numark Dj controller to a set of EV powered speakers. Simply needed to go from RCA to 1/4 and these mixer did that for me as well as give me a few extra channels to use.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G.

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use
customer_reviews.text: I use this for plugging my computer via RCA and my electronic piano via 1/4 cable. No static noise at all. Only problem i see is that it doesn't have a power switch. You must unplug the power cord if you want to turn this off.
customer_reviews.author: Dfbernal1

customer_reviews.title: Hum problems
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the warnings from several reviews which mentioned hum as I assumed they were from people who did not understand the importance of running all the audio equipment off a single supply and common ground, but I find myself suffering from quite significant hum after setting up my equipment very carefully with everything on one circuit and properly grounded, and all UPSes removed from the setup. I've always been able to eliminate hum before but this one has me stymied. UPDATE: reluctantly invested another $11 for awhich much to my surprise actually solved the problem! Quite surprising for a passive component. (It's a 1:1 transformer effectively, rather than an opto-isolator)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe they went with this power cord
customer_reviews.text: This power cord is a joke, where it plugs into the mixer is probably 1/4" deep at most, the tendency of the thing is to constantly come unplugged. I just don't understand why anyone would bother building something like this and giving no thought at all to providing it with a decent power supply. And of course electronics with unstable power connections are prone to shorts and malfunctions, so we will see. If I start using this thing in my live rig, I will definitely duct tape the power supply into the unit. It's really baffling that anyone would think this is a good design for power supply...
customer_reviews.author: Brian Surratt

customer_reviews.title: Great price, but too many negatives.
customer_reviews.text: Power cord/block is huge. The plug that goes into the mixer is non-standard, and doesn't stay inserted. No on/off switch. All of the above seem to be common complaints with this mixer. I have no idea what they were thinking with this power cord. Why so big and non-standard? After getting this mixer, I paid close attention to choosing its successor, and every other mixer I looked at had a typical barrel connector. This is my first mixer, so I won't comment on its sound or build quality. Sent it back, simply because it kept turning off because the plug barely engaged with the mixer body. Wouldn't even move it, and the plug would fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little mixer for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I have used other Behringer products before, including a larger mixer (1204USB). When I found myself needing a new, highly portable, mixer for just a few channels I looked at ordering this unit. I'm very glad I did! It works flawlessy, with no noisy signals. It's so simple that my 11 year old was able to pick up the controls quickly, too. While this doesn't have a TON of channels, it does the job it was purchased for and does it quite well! Update: After several gigs with this I can say that it's durable and reliable. My ONE complaint is the non-standard power plug (hope I never lose it).
customer_reviews.author: Shots

customer_reviews.title: Great except for power cord
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to mix down (to headphones or line-out) my electric bass guitar, a line input (iPhone or laptop) and a microphone for solo practice. With one major exception, this little unit is perfect. The exception is the power cable connector, right where it plugs into the back of the unit. Some reviews talk about it "clicking" into place to stay. Nope, mine doesn't, it's pretty loose at all times, and falls out with minor movements of the unit. I have it in a very stable location, so it's not too concerning for me. But someday I can see myself ripping the unit open, hardwiring the power cable, and throwing away these utterly horrible power cord connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Cepek

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer, but NOT +48v phantom power
customer_reviews.text: Good little mixer, especially for the price, but beware of one thing - it is NOT +48v phantom power. It's only +15v. This should be made clear in the description. If you have a condenser mic that requires +48v phantom power (most of them) you still may be able to use it through the X502, but you'll wonder why it sounds so very "hot" and tinny or think it's defective. Other than that this is a great mixer for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: vinniedafish

customer_reviews.title: Hi-fi for lo-budget
customer_reviews.text: I keep a mic, a bass, a guitar plugged into this mixer. I feed it into a 30 dolla UCA202, and this gives me a crystal clear and versatile audio interface for my DAW. I also have a Behringer UMX610 midi keyboard, run Reaper on a laptop with EZDrummer and Synth1 plug-ins, some M-Audio monitors, and have a cool studio for about $500. Using the stereo output I can record 2 separate mono instruments simultaneously. Great way to practice acoustic gtr with a tad of effects
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cirillo

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed. Not as ood as the reviews would have you believe
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to record voice-overs on videos. It has a bad hiss the comes through the headphones. At least it doesn't make it to the recording. Also, the left-right balance is almost all on the right speaker. To get anything on eh left speaker I have to turn the balance knob 75-80% to the left. Set in the middle I get no sound out of the left speaker. Looks like I expected to much for the price. I'll use this until I can aford somethign better. At that point this goes into recyeling.
customer_reviews.author: K. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Personal Home Recording Studio
customer_reviews.text: So happy for prime same day shipping 😉 I only needed a small mixer for home studio. This worked great Connecting my Condenser microphone, Monitoring speakers, Headphones, & my phone to play instrumentals & Record my vocals. Was easy to adjust my voice with equalizer as well with some creativity & a variety of different wires I managed to connect both microphone & my phone so I could use the equalizer channel on my voice and the beat it came out great sound quality wise!
customer_reviews.author: King☆Random

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Is Noisy & Has Proprietary Line Wart
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I needed a small mixer for live sets with my synth rig. However, all is not well. It has a proprietary line wart power supply that is heavier than the mixer itself. Also, in spite of impressive S/N specs (on paper) this mixer hisses like a snake with background noise. There is a reason Yamaha’s similar mixer costs $99.99, but performs like pro gear & Behringer charges $39.99 for a mixer that promises similar performance, but falls way short of the mark. I guess I got what I paid for?!
customer_reviews.author: Delubious

customer_reviews.title: Great personal mixer for Drummers!
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up to my Roland TM-2 drum module to the main input to run my kick triggers, then used the 2nd input to run a snare Mic with the volume barely up, just to add a lil extra crack to the mix in my band's rehearsals. Run the mixer into a D.I. box then out to the PA mixer board. The results were pure perfection! My kicks sound incredible after getting them dialed in and the lil extra on the snare added is just enough without being overbearing. So to all the drummers out there this is a killer little mixer. A+
customer_reviews.author: Shane Newbrough

customer_reviews.title: Manual Saying 48V Phantom Power is a MISPRINT
customer_reviews.text: Multiple sources have contacted the manufacturer and it has been determined that this mixer only outputs 15V of phantom power, not the 48V written in the manual. This is actually not that big of a problem seeing that most electret condenser microphones can operate as low as 9V just fine even if their spec sheet has 48V slapped on it. 48V is an industry hold over from earlier designs of the 20th century. However, this is till a major oversight that needs to be corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.text: This is fantasatic! I play bass in my band and struggle to hear what I'm playing at times. I have an effects processor that has 2 outs on it. I send on of these back to the amp and the other to this unit. I also have the click track plugged into it so I can hear what I am playing and the click track at the same time. Exactly what I've been looking for. The unit feels well made. Power cable is decent length. It feels secure when plugged into the unit. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: h8ed

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Device!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little device. I can control several key components of my sound system with this puppy. Multiple inputs so I can load music on one, and play music on another input. Without the use of an expensive mixing board. Microphones, bass amp, regular audio amp, master volume control, que in music with headphones. With 2 outputs I can send the signal to regular amp and bass amp to really enhance performance
customer_reviews.author: Dave P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer for mixing down multiple instruments live
customer_reviews.text: I use this to mix down 2 keyboards running stereo (4 1/4" TRS inputs) into 2 outputs (stereo) for a live band. It works well for this, and probably other purposes. Its easy to use, the power cable is long enough for this application. I use a stereo direct box to take the 1/4" outputs to XLR. I can use this for very small dj gigs as well (Laptop and a Mic for example) Great buy for the money. Would buy again, in fact, this is my second one. I lost the first somehow, and missed it dearly! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item not even a month ago, and the head amp in it is already blown. I can't raise the level of my line inputs past 0, or my signal gets terribly distorted. This literally began happening today, after having this since July 19th. It was an incredible mixer for the two weeks that it worked, and I never tested the limits of signal coming in, so I'm confused and upset about this mixer already malfunctioning like this.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Quiles

customer_reviews.title: love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: cant go wrong with beringer boards...ive never had a problem with any of their boards. we have an x32, and like 3 other beringer analog boards. we use this for small parties to run a mic and some music and its durable reliable and great value for the price we paid. love that it alos has the rca connections. Would like to see a bluetooth capability with boards this small.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Berhinger is a good device
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted was compression for a varying sound source to my video streaming suite. This one did it so I don't have to track the level of the audio coming from the sound board very much. It keeps the level pretty constant. Saves a lot of work in editing.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene M Wood

customer_reviews.title: Must have been a lemon
customer_reviews.text: This little behringer Xenyx 502 never did work for me, out of all the items that my company has bought this unit never did work, when it came in we were on the road and it stayed in a box in the shop and months, when we did fired it up the red light came on and nothing else. In our studio we one working that we did not buy from Amazon. So now it has become a paper weight I wish we could return it for a replacement not a refund but I think it is to late.
customer_reviews.author: joe britt

customer_reviews.title: Immediately broke
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I plugged it in, the power light came on for a few seconds and then turned off. Has not worked at all. Not sure what to do. I really wanted to like this, but this is not a good first impression. On the other hand, the overall build quality seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: For my simple needs, so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very simple amp with limited eq abilities, but if all you need is something to bridge form your USB-to-RCA converter to your external speakers, as well as a return and a mic input, this works fine. If I were to buy this again I would have upgraded to the next-better mixer, but this does the job. My only major gripe is no on-off switch. To turn it off you have to unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: No frills but sounds and works great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to manage multiple sound sources for a pair of Pyle Pro PPHP103MU 10" 600W Powered Two-Way PA Speaker with MP3/USB/SD Playback units purchase for use at a non-profit. Purchased based on reviews here and I have not been disappointed. Had to purchase some additional cables, but everything sounds great. It took 5 minutes to figure out how to use the features. We use the entire system for PA, Music/DJ and Movie night outdoors with a projector and the unit works flawlessly. I am not a sound engineer, but for what we need this little unit does a great job without any fancy frills. Which is ideal since there is less to break as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: themosquito

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop mixer
customer_reviews.text: Great for trying to multitask a few different sounds. I have mine on my desk and mix my PC, guitar amp, video games/TV and music (not all at the same time of course) and it sounds great. There is no lack of sound quality on the output side, however I have only tested with small speakers and headphones and can't say how it performs on larger speakers. My only suggestions would be to add a power switch instead of having to unplug to power cable every time you want it to turn off. It does get pretty warm if you leave it on for a few hours (shouldn't be an issue unless you keep your room at 90°).
customer_reviews.author: T-rav

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a pair of headphones so I can practice guitar without annoying my wife. It works very well for that purpose and is versitile enough to keep around for the potential side project. I'd like to see a little more EQ control on the preamp channel and you do need to make sure the power cord is plugged in properly, but for the price it serves my purposes quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best price-quality rate
customer_reviews.text: Behringer is always the best relation between price and quality. It is of high quality, not the best but very good = german standards, and the best price you can get a good quality product for. That is the philosophy of the company, if you want to know why, investigate its history. Again, I am very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Leon-Geyer

customer_reviews.title: Good Mixer for my Application
customer_reviews.text: I use the equipment to mix the sounds of my electric piano, with Ipad, into my earphones and our outward towards an exterior set of speakers. The mixing sound is good quality and I don't hear any static noise
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Galdamez

customer_reviews.title: Love this liitle guy !
customer_reviews.text: So I'm a keyboardist and recently went to 2 keyboards ( 88 key on bottom and 61 key B2 organ clone on top ) and this mixer sites nicely on my bottom keyboard and enables me to send 2 stereo line outs from each of my keyboards into mixer and then just 1 stereo line out to my QSC K8 . Takes up minimum space and is clean with 0 distortion
customer_reviews.author: stumper

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly the most ideal layout of controls for this ...
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly the most ideal layout of controls for this size of a mixer, but sounds clear and clean. I'm just using it as a headphone amp for my drummer so he can have his monitor mix and a click track mixed together.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Brainerd

customer_reviews.title: Great value and excellent Products
customer_reviews.text: Great value and excellent Products. I bought this to gain some control over the input to my sound system. I got a lot more value than expected for the price. Nice small foot print so it does not take up a lot of space. No hiss, buzz or anything that feels/sounds cheap
customer_reviews.author: Julius A. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Broke after about a year
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cool little mixer to eq and control 2 powered stage monitors. Worked really well for about 25 shows up until channel one went into a permanent hum status with no output. We got by using one of the stereo channels but channel one is now inoperable. We’ve switched all cords and checked connections. Replaced it with a Mackie mix5. Hopefully better luck with that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and value.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic go-between for recording into my computer. Lots of control and the sound quality is great. No hum or buzz detected. Very good value and a nice step up in my recording quality.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: for under $50, it's hard to complain. It works for me, but having the same volume knob for 2 seperate channels is a bit annoying. As far as I can tell, the only way to turn off the unit is to unplug it, which is also a bit annoying. But, given that I am upgrading from a 3 channel board that only had 2 working channels, I'm pleased with this mixer. **UPDATE** I got a condenser mic that needs phantom power and my board just can't handle it. Seems like the channel is completely screwed up now and the board only accepts RCA inputs now, so that's sad.
customer_reviews.author: NPH

customer_reviews.title: You need to be an expert to get it worked
customer_reviews.text: This is not a mixer for a normal person. You need to be number 1 expert in electronic to make it worked. I build computer for years never need helps with electronic stuffs but can’t get this mixer to work. I’m sure 99% person who bought this could not make it work after months of searching. Avoid at all cost. Zero star. Very poor instruction.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good, not the best for streaming
customer_reviews.text: This mixer will do the job, however, it will disapoint for streaming. Specifically, the microphone output to the computer is limited to the phono out, or main mix out. This will work for the most part, however if you use Discord, it will route all audio with the microphone audio. I would suggest using the 802 version, as this has the aux/fx out. The aux/fx out will allow you to isolate the mic audio from the rest of the mix.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hagen

customer_reviews.title: I did not take good care of it at all
customer_reviews.text: This broke a few weeks ago. I did not take good care of it at all, but that's the users fault. It also does not have enough XLR inputs and outputs, but at the time, I needed something simple, so it worked great at the time
customer_reviews.author: Adeus

customer_reviews.title: just wish there was some type of desk stand for it to get a better view. power connector is proprietary which is mildly ...
customer_reviews.text: works really well! just wish there was some type of desk stand for it to get a better view. power connector is proprietary which is mildly annoying, Would love to see a locking power cord in the future, or maybe an on/off switch for the board. Solid board for the money though.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: There's not much need in a basic voiceover production studio for more than three channels these days ... mike, audio out for the editing machine and an auxilliary line input for whatever else one may need to feed. This little mixer fits on my desk without displacing the rest of my "stuff," and does what I need. Yes, someday I'll want effect returns and multiple-bus capability - I may also want something that has more of that "studio look" forshow. But for a basic one-man studio, this is a basic mixer that does a quality job without fanfare.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Onsted

customer_reviews.title: Great product...a steal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight, high quality piece of equipment. I used it to feed music from dish in a restaurant to the music system I installed. If I were recording my own music and needed to feed it to a pc or such, I think would also work great for that type of application. It's pretty versatile in that you have one channel that can input XLR or 1/4". Then you have several other 1/4" or RCA inputs. For the price, it's a steal. Don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: P. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: rotary knobs can get noisy after a year
customer_reviews.text: A small mixer was nearly perfect for playing back my mid-side stereo recordings. I used a modified cable assembly and two mixer channels to hear stereo with out "matrixing" the mid and side channels first. What's not perfect--one of the controls is beginning to get noisy, which I think is premature after only a year of moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: a. listener

customer_reviews.title: Great mic amp
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. The price isn't that bad in it work with no issues the only problem is that only way to turn it off is to unplug the cable out of the unit to turn it off which sucks. IF you find it on sale in need it for anything mic related i would pick this up in a flash.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Hill

customer_reviews.title: ... seal should never be broken the box itself looked like it was part of world war 2 with the ...
customer_reviews.text: The Behringer box it came in was opened before it was shipped to me so the seal was broken on the box -when you buy a new item the seal should never be broken the box itself looked like it was part of world war 2 with the amount of damage it had on it the item itself was re-wrapped no parts missing will update this review after a week of testing the unit itself out but for now buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Volume Knobs Jittery & Volume on 1/4 Jack is SO QUIET
customer_reviews.text: Really meh. When I tried to fade in audio, it wasn't smooth. It would glitch as I slowly turned the knob. The knob sucks to fade in anyway. When hooking up a mic with a female XLR to 1/4 (into the mixer), it was so quiet that I had to turn the gain almost all the way up... which made a hissing noise. Power cord looks flimsy. No pads to keep it from sliding around.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer for under $50
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little mixer for under $50. It's great to bring to a smaller jam session where everyone might not have mics or if you're going for a quieter practice session. This could also be good as a personal monitor mix at a gig, especially if you play drums and need to hear the rest of the band. My only warning is the correct input is unpowered, so using this with a mic that requires phantom power isn't going to work.
customer_reviews.author: MacCrea Bisel

customer_reviews.title: Works well, Great entry level mixer
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, and it was the least expensive way to get started with professional-quality recording. However, once I got the hang of it, I almost immediately realized I needed more Mic inputs. Theis only $20 more, so I'd recommend that one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan P.

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to manage my audio at my pc and works great, supplies phantom power for my mic and great clean audio for my headphones and monitor speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Mixer and headphone amp in disguise!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the audio quality and to mix audio sources. Thought I would need an amp for my HD 6XXs but the 502 powers the 6XXs nicely. The build quality is good for the price. My only gripe is audio starts to fade to one side when in the lower volume ranges.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon K

customer_reviews.title: Overall Poor Construction
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all. I own other Behringer mixers, so I was very disappointed in the build quality of this unit. Especially bad is the jack for the power transformer - wouldn't hold the plug. Unfortunately, I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: James Cushinery

customer_reviews.title: $40 Paper Weight
customer_reviews.text: Had it for 2 months, RCA jacks never worked, should have sent it back then but since I found a way around that (utilizing the headphone jack) I kept it just to have it crap out a couple months later... Unfortunately my window for returns closed a month ago so now I have a $40 paper weight. Still waiting on reply from behringer
customer_reviews.author: badseed01

customer_reviews.title: Compact size. Perfect for my application.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to mix two computers and my Lowrey organ into one output. Small enough to fit on a small shelf but big on features.
customer_reviews.author: NewTech

customer_reviews.title: Great board for the money
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little mixer. its great if you are going to do some lite recording or are wanting to set up microphones for a live stream. Its also good for small gigs that a DJ might come across. The sound coming out is clear and there is no static or undo interference. It does get warm though, but thats hardly a negative. I use it every day and rarely turn it off. Its a great little mixer board and I would buy it again if I needed another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Island

customer_reviews.title: Stereo Input and Output
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. I have connected my Korg keyboard and my laptop to the Mixer and have extended the sound to my speakers and headphone via stereo outputs. It is exactly what I wanted to do. I have control over each input and each output, plus I can balance to left and right channels if I want to. There is still another input available to connect the Mic but I do not use.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great mixer for the money. No problem w/the power cord but I understand why others could have a problem w/it. Simply push it in till it "locks" into place. If it's not "locked" in then it will still power on but will turn off w/slightest movement. So simply make sure it's "locked" into place.
customer_reviews.author: greg tish

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This little mixer is perfect for small Youtube projects and fits nicely on a desk. I have experience with pro audio equipment and larger mixers in theaters/auditoriums but still believe this mixer is very easy to use. My main criticism is that it gets a bit warm and could really use a power switch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little mixer. I use it for voice work and the EQ is smple to dial in my various Mike's. Wish it had phanfom power, though.
customer_reviews.author: Mindless Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Power adapter has a poor design
customer_reviews.text: This little mixer is cute, portable, and works well EXCEPT for the power adapter. There are three tiny pins in the cord that need to match up straight to the back of the mixer and need to be plugged in and unplugged with the utmost of care. I discovered that the hard way. After only a few uses, the pins were either bent or gone and the mixer couldn't get enough power through to turn on. Sorry, Behringer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Siefert

customer_reviews.title: I ended up putting my old Peavy in its place and it worked great. I took too long to return it
customer_reviews.text: This unit needs a lot of drive signal on the stereo line input (RCA) I was feeding it with a cd player. I had all the gains all the way up. I ended up putting my old Peavy in its place and it worked great. I took too long to return it
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: No ground pin = annoying mains hum
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this to mix two sources to feed a TOSLink connection back to PC input. Unfortunately this doesn't have a ground prong so it too injects mains hum. I needed to add a makeshift ground point but it's unreliable. Disappointed that grounding wasn't considered in the product design
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and produces good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This mixer was very reasonable. As it turns out I don't need it for it's intended purpose. I purchased this to use to control the audio on one of my radios but I just don't need it. I gave it to my son to use with his computer. He works with audio and music on his pc so when he saw that I wasn't using it he jumped on it. The only negative aspect is that there is no power switch. You have to unplug the power adapter to shut it off. For a lazy guy like me, I consider that to be a pain in the neck. Otherwise, for under $ 50 you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Nighthawk

customer_reviews.title: Worst Warranty Policy Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Worst warranty policies ever. Worst to deal with as a company. Cannot ship directly to them for warranty. If you receive a unit that's not fully functioning they will not replace. Products may be ok if you get a good one but be warned a bad one will be the death of you.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Becker

customer_reviews.title: this is a good fit.
customer_reviews.text: This little workhorse is exactly what I needed, at an affordable price. Historically, I've had Behringer products fail just outside the warranty period... hoping this one lasts. For really simple mix applications, this is a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: RHolt

customer_reviews.title: barely get any sound with it turn it all the ...
